unnormalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Renewable Energy Boost for Rural India**
normalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Renewable Energy Boost for Rural India**

unnormalised: New Delhi - A new initiative spearheaded by Dr. Anil Sharma at IIT-Bombay aims to bring renewable energy solutions to remote villages across India. The "Jyoti Kiran" project focuses on solar power microgrids capable of powering entire communities, reducing reliance on traditional fossil fuels and significantly decreasing carbon emissions.
normalised: New Delhi - A new initiative spearheaded by Doctor Anil Sharma at I I T hyphen Bombay aims to bring renewable energy solutions to remote villages across India. The "Jyoti Kiran" project focuses on solar power microgrids capable of powering entire communities, reducing reliance on traditional fossil fuels and significantly decreasing carbon emissions.

unnormalised: The project, launched on October 26, 2024, in collaboration with the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE), initially targets 50 villages in the Sundarbans delta. Each microgrid covers approximately 10,000 sq ft and will provide electricity for homes, schools, and local businesses.
normalised: The project, launched on twenty sixth October two thousand and twenty four, in collaboration with the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E), initially targets fifty villages in the Sundarbans delta. Each microgrid covers approximately ten thousand square feet and will provide electricity for homes, schools, and local businesses.

unnormalised: The initiative is projected to save villagers Rs. 5000 annually on energy costs. Beyond electricity, the project also includes training programs for locals on maintaining the systems, ensuring long-term sustainability. The long-term goal is to replicate this model across India, promoting energy independence and environmental conservation. This echoes the Gandhian philosophy of Swaraj, empowering communities to be self-sufficient.
